ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.2_0: a family that was supporting the nun Thullanandā said to her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.3_0: “Venerables, we’ll give robe-cloth to the Sangha of nuns.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.4_0: Because they had done the robe-making procedure, the nun Thullanandā
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.5_0: “You’re very busy,” and she created an obstacle for them.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.6_0: Soon afterwards the house flourished that family.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.7_0: They then complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.8_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for our gift?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.9_0: Now we have neither possessions nor merit.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.10_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.11_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.12_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for a group to obtain a robe?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.13_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.16_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.18_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.19.1_0: ‘If a nun creates an obstacle for a group to obtain a robe, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.6_0: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.8_0: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.10_0: if she creates an obstacle with the thought, “What can be done so that these people don’t give robe-cloth?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.11_0: If she creates an obstacle for another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.12_0: If she creates an obstacle for several nuns, a robe-cloth, or a nun who is not fully ordained nun, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.2_0: if she obstructs them after demonstrating a benefit;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.4_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.5_0: The sixth training rule is finished.
